greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n such that all parts are equal or all parts are distinct.
comment: Note that for positive integers the number of partitions of n such that all parts are equal is equal to the number of proper divisors of n. (A032741(n)).
link: Omar E. Pol, Illustration of the shell model of partitions (2D and 3D view)
Omar E. Pol, Illustration of the shell model of partitions (2D view)
Omar E. Pol, Illustration of the shell model of partitions (3D view)
mathematica: ds[n_]:=Module[{lun=Length[Union[n]]},Length[n]==lun||lun==1]; Table[ Count[ IntegerPartitions[n],_?(ds)],{n,0,60}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 13 2011 *)
